page.title: 13Block D7
page.content: This area,too,is densely populated.In the north of the area can be seen Mynachlog Farm,reputedly to have been part of an early monastery.Of some historical interest,before their demolition were Banc Tai Newydd,two 17'th century cottages.Two chapels are to be seen within this block_ Hen Soar ,built in 1834(now a builders store_ room),and Soar Newydd,built in 1904. Both were Calvanistic Methodist chapels.Opposite Hen Soar is located the oldest Council housing estate in Pontyberem.PARC-MYNACH(the Monk's Park).On the other side of the new Primary School is one of the best kept parks in the whole of Dyfed-PARC PONTYBEREM.It encompasses the village's sports ground catering for rugby football,tennis and cricket.Both Pontyberem R.F.C.and Cricket team are succesful in their South Wales....
